nodes.title: Telepresence Manifesto (2018 redux)
nodes.description:
today in critical theory, we read and discussed a few â€œmanifestos for the internet ageâ€. iâ€™ve got a cold so i called in; when the class broke out to create their own manifestos, i decided to write a â€œtelepresence manifestoâ€ from my sniffly blanket fort.

turns out marvin minsky beat me to it. for context: minsky, who said â€œi donâ€™t think there is any such thingâ€ regarding human consciousness, co-founded MITâ€™s AI laboratory. MIT has a long history of military research; in recent years, its public focus has shifted to military robots, drones, and battle suits.

his manifesto creeps me out. i changed â€œhandsâ€ to â€œdronesâ€ to emphasize why. Edits left as strikethroughs; emphasis my own.

nodes.title: unhitching
nodes.description:
The possibility, vital for life, of unhitching, which consistsâ€¦ in grasping, during the brief intervals in which our species can bring itself to interrupt its hive-like activity, the essence of what it was and continues to be, below the threshold of thought and over and above society: in the contemplation of a mineral more beautiful than all our creations; in the scent that can be smelt at the heart of a lily and is more imbued with learning than all our books; or in the brief glance, heavy with patience, serenity and mutual forgiveness, that, through some involuntary understanding, one can sometimes exchange with a cat.

Claude LÃ©vi-Strauss, â€œTristes Tropiquesâ€

nodes.title: making nothing
nodes.description:
hereâ€™s a post that i wrote during my second week here. now that the showcase is coming up, i need to start making a thing. guess iâ€™d better put this up before that starts :)

one of my major goals during this program is to not make things.

* silence. the sfpc showcase curators back away slowly to discuss what a mistake theyâ€™ve made. *

itâ€™s okay, iâ€™ll do the assignments and make a showcase project and all that. iâ€™m still going to make things. itâ€™s hard not to; iâ€™ve already made a lot of Things since arriving, more than iâ€™m comfortable with. but iâ€™m celebrating all the things i think of that i donâ€™t make.

during the binary numbers assignment, i came up with an idea to:

  • map binary digits (bits) to piano keys
  • find binary numbers that resolve to nice chords
  • create a simple matching app that prompts players with a decimal number and celebrates when the correct chord is played

nodes.title: border crossing
nodes.description:
headed back to canada for the weekend to see the AGOâ€™s yayoi kusama exhibit (RAD!) and attend a funky dance (RAD!). iâ€™m back at the airport now and made it through (phewf). explaining this school at customs is always complicated, and iâ€™ve been pulled into secondary each time.

with this weekâ€™s readings on â€œsecurityâ€ + surveillance for our crit theory course (â€œthe radical outsideâ€) fresh on my mind, the customs experience was heightened. last time reached an ABSURD level of invasiveness with questions about my family. this time was just lots of silence as i pondered what the neural nets were cooking up.

lil thought: upon saying i quit my job just over a month ago, the agent said â€œoh - thatâ€™s a really long timeâ€. Work is a weed weâ€™re feeding ğŸŒ± neoliberal capitalism, â€œwe eat for youâ€, soapbox, etc.
